text: on the hills outside Mariupol they are
digging fresh trenches preparing for a
new onslaught from the east the men
digging them are not professional
soldiers until a year ago they were
farmers and factory workers and it's
very unclear how much they really want
to fight if there is going to be an
attack on Mary appalled by the rebels
this is where it is going to come from
we've been told that there is fighting
going on about two kilometers down the
hill from here in a village but even
these freshly dug positions here outside
Mariupol came under shellfire this
morning most of the equipment here is
ancient Kalashnikov rifles and a few old
Soviet era armored cars not enough says
their commander to stop the rebels if
they come more pure look me up could you
map your justice is your problem
we need better communications and
surveillance drones we need more modern
anti-tank weapons because they have
Russian t-90s tanks which are much
better than ours we need sniper rifles
and we need vehicles like your British
Land Rovers they would be excellent
after just a few minutes here we're told
we must leave it's no longer safe as
we're driving away two more shells
explode a few hundred meters behind us
further down the road we're stopped at a
checkpoint like everyone here the
soldiers speak fluent Russian but any
warm feelings they once had for their
cousins across the border is now long
gone I don't feel like that anymore
he says Russians are a bunch of
mercenaries and cutthroats they came to
Ukraine we didn't go to them then as we
wait to clear the checkpoint something
very strange happens while we've been
waiting at this checkpoint we've seen
one group of what look like Ukrainian
militiamen draw up here in cars heavily
armed they were then held at gunpoint
and disarmed by the Ukrainian soldiers
on this checkpoint for a while it was
very very tense and it gives you an idea
of just how chaotic how much confusion
there is here between different units of
the Ukrainian military
eventually the standoff ends and someone
leaves in a great hurry such confusion
and suspicion does not bode well for the
ability of the forces here to defend
this city against rebel attack Roopa
dwinfield Hayes BBC News in Mariupol
eastern Ukraine
